label: 御七日御修法
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
見出し読み: ごしちにち みしほう
見出し読み_mod: ごしちにち みしほう
説明文: Latter Seventh Day Rite, a complex ritual lasting from the seventh through the fourteenth day of the new year and entailed a week of lectures on the Golden Light Excellent King Sutra (Konkomyo saisho okyo). This ritual was designed to provide for peace in the realm and increase fortune, and entailed the offering of the Wish-Fulfilling Jewel (cintamani), one of the regalia of a Universal Golden Wheel-Turning Monarch (cakravartin).
